channel.title: Portrait of the American
channel.description:
Series that examines assessments of the American using the themes of innocence, affluence, success and the American self. Features analysis by Dr. Betty Ch'maj, interviews, dramatic readings. Series features interviews with John Dos Passos, James Farmer, Marshall Fishwick, Alan Harrington, Ihab Hassan, Irving Howe, Alfred Kazin, R.W.B. Lewis, and William H. Whyte, Jr.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Moralists and misfits
item.description: This program looks at various moralists and misfits and their roles in the American character.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: How to know you've made it
item.description: What success means today and how it is measured. Status-seeking, oneupmanship. Stages in the slow climb; signals to which the American responds; signals he ignores.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: Patterns and paradox
item.description: Summary of series showing what has happened to the portrait of the American.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The burdens of plenty
item.description: Affluence continued; critique of, guilt about, use and misuse of. Money as the root of "evil" opposed to innocence.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: Immigrants: Again and again
item.description: Innocence and moralism as they react to the European setting; contrast of values; James to Baldwin.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The happy company men
item.description: The force of conformity in business, university, political, social life today. Patterns in suburbia; critique of togetherness.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: Quest for self
item.description: Fourth theme: the American self. Inner-direction to other direction.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The aggressive American
item.description: Self-reliance of Emerson and frontier thesis. Preoccupation with size, attitudes toward space, mobility, capabilities, dynamism, belief in free will.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The advent of Babbitts
item.description: The big change in economic history, literary traditions, and the American character. The effect of social codes on the American. The tribal Americans and their rituals of affability.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: Who are we as Americans?
item.description: This program seeks an answer to the question: Who are we as Americans?
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: Rugged and not-so-rugged individualists
item.description: Third theme: the American success myth; Protestant ethic; versions of individualism.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The affluent American
item.description: Second theme: American affluence, interpretations, meanings of; effects on areas of life and modern values.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching

item.title: The American Adam and evil
item.description: Innocence unawares: The American as the New Man in a virgin land; reaction to evil; Billy Budd.
item.dc:creator: Ch'maj, Betty E. M.
item.dc:subject: United States--Study and teaching
